repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Here and There at Tufts

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the physical edition of Here and There at Tufts from 1907 along with digital representations of several of its pages. This is a yearbook-like publication written by students from the Class of 1909. It was dedicated to William Rollin Shipman.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The undergraduates that graduated in 1909 would have, on average, entered Tufts College in the fall of 1905. This class is best known for the creation of the 1907 Here and There at Tufts, a year-book like publication that was dedicated to Tufts professor William Rollin Shipman.

processinfo.head: Processing status
processinfo.p: This collection is processed and open for research

did.unittitle: Here and There at Tufts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains Here and There at Tufts. "Tufts has reached that point in her history where the many traditions and events of student life and activities should be suitably recorded, and we hope that this book has fulfilled these conditions." Organized by the class of 1909. Signed by Lewis Doane, Leroy James Cook and Edwin Morey.
